title: Armando Solar-Lezama named inaugural Distinguished Professor of Computing
summary: Armando Solar-Lezama has been named the inaugural Distinguished Professor of Computing at the MIT Stephen A. Schwarzman College of Computing. The position was generously funded by Professor Jae S. Lim and is awarded to Solar-Lezama for his outstanding contributions to MIT and the scientific community. Solar-Lezama leads the Computer-Aided Programming Group at MIT, focusing on program synthesis, which combines programming systems and artificial intelligence. His research includes designing new analysis techniques and automated reasoning mechanisms, as well as developing programming models that automate challenging aspects of programming.
